statement.p: Draw the region bounded by y={{ f }}, the x-axis, and the line x={{right}}.

Suppose this region is revolved about the x-axis.
Is a representative slice going to be horizontal or vertical?
Should we use disks or washers?
What is the approximate volume of a representative slice?
Write down a definite integral that computes the volume of this solid of revolution. (Bonus points for finding the value.)

Suppose this region is revolved about the line x = {{leftaxis}}.
Is a representative slice going to be horizontal or vertical?
Should we use disks or washers?
What is the approximate volume of a representative slice?
Write down a definite integral that computes the volume of this solid of revolution. (Bonus points for finding the value.)

answer.p:
About the x-axis: vertical slices get revolved into disks.
\displaystyle V_\textrm{slice} = \pi \left( {{f}} \right)^2 \Delta x , so
\displaystyle V_\textrm{total} = \int_0^{ {{right}} }\pi \left( {{f}} \right)^2\ dx .

About the line x={{leftaxis}}: horizontal slices get revolved into washers.
\displaystyle V_\textrm{slice} = \pi \left[ ({{right}} - ({{leftaxis}}))^2 - \left( {{g}} - ({{leftaxis}})\right)^2 \right] \Delta y , so
\displaystyle V_\textrm{total} = \int_0^{ {{top}} }\pi \left[ ({{right}} - ({{leftaxis}}))^2 - \left( {{g}} - ({{leftaxis}})\right)^2 \right]\ dy .
